definition: the curtain drops/the end of the show
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind
curtain or screen/canopy or tent/headquarters of a general/act (of a play)
old variant of 幕[mu4]/curtain/screen

sentences.english: A year later, my cruel and desperate for your story.
sentences.chinese: 壹年后，我的残忍加你的绝情让故事落幕。

sentences.english: And here let the curtain fall.
But this may be the beginning of the end of an era.
sentences.chinese: “但这样一个时代或许已经开始落幕了”。

sentences.english: They were still applauding when the curtain rang down for the final time.
sentences.chinese: 最后一次鸣铃落幕时，他们的掌声依然不息。

sentences.english: The 16-year-old became the youngest ever winner of the World 9-ball Championships.
sentences.chinese: 世界女子九球锦标赛沈阳落幕，刘莎莎成最年轻冠军。

sentences.english: Are you touched by the music when the movie ends?
sentences.chinese: 电影落幕时，你被它的片尾曲感动了吗？

sentences.english: In this never-ending drama we call life, everyone has a part to play.
sentences.chinese: 在人生这场永不落幕的戏剧中，人人都有自己的戏份。

sentences.english: The party ended amid cheers, whose heart is not calm.
sentences.chinese: 晚会在欢呼声中落幕，谁的心都不能平静。

sentences.english: Hours later, the party begins winding down.
sentences.chinese: 又过了几个小时，派对开始落幕了。

sentences.english: The party that is sponsored by teacher Tung this time ended successfully, congratulating .
sentences.chinese: 这次由董老师主办的导生会圆满落幕了，可贺可喜。

sentences.english: As it gets too cold, the drama of the Karakoum Desert at night comes to a close.
sentences.chinese: 气温太低时，卡拉库姆沙漠的夜间好戏也随之落幕。

sentences.english: The death of Zhou Ya-Fu was the tragic sign of the end of the Milita…
sentences.chinese: 周亚夫之死，就是功臣集团的落幕悲歌。

sentences.english: Here comes the party pooper . I guess this party's over.
sentences.chinese: 派对杀手来了，我看这场欢宴就要落幕了。

sentences.english: I'll give you a signal to ring down the curtain when the scene is over.
sentences.chinese: 等这一场演完，我会给你发出鸣铃落幕的信号。

sentences.english: The sun would ring down, pulling darkness after it like a curtain.
sentences.chinese: 夕阳会西下，像落幕似地把夜暮降下。

definition: to take a curtain call/(fig.) to come to an end
heavy curtain
(fig.) to raise the curtain/to lift the curtain/to be a curtain raiser for
the curtain falls/lower the curtain/to come to an end (of a meeting)
termination/to finish/to end/to conclude/to close
"Red Poppies", novel by 阿來|阿来[A1 lai2]
lit. the dust has settled (idiom)/fig. to get sorted out/to be finalized
to elapse/to pass away/to die/demise
period (punctuation)/(fig.) endpoint/finish
full stop/period (punct.)
prologue
to arrive as planned/right on schedule
coda/epilogue/end
The End (appearing at the end of a movie etc)
feast
to leave a place where some event is taking place/(of an actor) to exit/(sports) to leave the field/(of an audience) to leave
to screen (a movie)/to stage (a play)/a screening/a staging
